ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] RE: Resources and URIs
ygData.msgSnippet: I think it s important that URIs *can* be treated opaquely - you can link to them, you can cache their resources without processing them beyond naive

Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] RE: Resources and URIs
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=164939419; y=Jv776Du1Ya9FaZcJVDJF6zzryFh1CfdHDFXGmYwF9X99a4P1
X-Yahoo-Profile: hack_poet

I think it's important that URIs *can* be treated opaquely - you can 
link to them, you can cache their resources without processing them 
beyond naive string-matching, process RDF graphs again without 
processing them beyond naive string-matching, and so on.

This does not preclude the fact that agents *may* construct or parse 
URIs in more sophisticated ways, it just means that agents don't have 
to, especially in the case of agents that are not aware of the specific 
purpose of the application.
